resources.string: If the login and signup button is disabled, it means the web panel is inactive. If so, just tap the \"Fetch Server\" button
Allows you to communicate with SecureGuard via a pin. You will be added to a temporary allowlist.
Used as confirmation before wiping the device or for temporary usage of the service.
The command used to communicate with the SecureGuard application.
Select a ringtone that will be played when "/sg ring" is sent.
Lock Screen Message:\nWhen locking the device, this message will appear on the lock screen.
You need the user ID to find your device with SecureGuard Server. Write it down and keep it safe.
This will delete all data from the Server! Are you sure?
Sending commands from SecureGuard Server to your phone requires a UnifiedPush distributor app. Install one, and then return here. It will automatically be detected.
SecureGuard uploads the device\'s location every X minutes.
If none is selected, no locations are uploaded regularly. (You can still use the web interface to force an upload. This requires push.)
Upload the location of this device when the battery level goes low. This requires Notification Access.
At least server version {MIN} is required, but the selected server has version {CURRENT}. Continue at your own risk.
Using SecureGuard Server allows you to send commands over the internet from the server to the app. You can track the device location on a map and view pictures taken by the device.
Private instances may require a secret token. Leave this empty if the instance is public.
The contacts in this list are allowed to send SecureGuard commands via SMS. Commands from everyone else will be ignored.
No allowed contacts. Click the button to your contacts!
Select one of the phone numbers.

Congratulations. You have added your first contact. You can now communicate with SecureGuard by sending a SMS message that contains \"sg\" from the allowed phone number. When everything works, the application will respond.

FMD can use the OpenCelliD service to get an approximate location based on the cell tower that the phone is connected to. An internet connection is required for every location query. You also need to create an account at OpenCelliD and get your own API Access Token.
Privacy: keep in mind that OpenCelliD learns your current cell tower and thus your location with every API query.

SecureGuard allows you to remotely locate your device. You can communicate with SecureGuard over SMS, instant messengers, or using SecureGuard Server. Locate your device, make it ring, lock it, or wipe it - all from remote.
You need to update some settings to continue using SecureGuard. Click to open.

Unregistering failed with the following error: {ERROR}\n\nYou can continue anyway, but your account might not have been deleted from the server. If you continue, your account will be deleted locally from this device.
Notification about the Lifecycle of the Service.
Display notifications sent from the server.
Notification when something fails, like the connection to SecureGuard server.
This application is supposed to work in the background. To ensure it works even when your phone is in standby, you need to turn off battery optimization for this app.

SecureGuard is an application that can help you find your phone when it gets lost.

It uses SMS (texting) to communicate and send commands from a second device so you can track your phone.Just send a SMS message that contains the "/sg" command.

Please note that this application is experimental.

 - Mark
Some new permissions are needed.\nPlease check the following permissions in order to continue using this application, or change back to an older version.

In order to command the phone to do something, this application needs to be able to see your SMS messages.

Your messages never leave your phone, and they are never used for anything except finding your phone.

This Permission is needed.
Not everybody is allowed to send commands to your phone, so you need to select some contacts who will be able to locate your device.\n\nThis permission is needed.

If you want to get the GPS coordinates from your phone, the application needs this permission.

Please also allow the application to locate your phone in the background.

If you don't give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.

You can make your phone ring to help you locate it. When \"Do Not Disturb\" is active, it may be possible that the phone is muted.\n\nIf you don\'t give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.
If you want to lock or wipe your phone if it gets lost, this permission is needed.\n\nIf you don\'t give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.

This application is capable of turning on location if you normally leave location off.

If it is off, "/sg locate" will not work.

In order to achieve this, the application needs a special permission that you have to grant using a computer.

This permission is OPTIONAL, If you don't give this permission, it's no problem. You can still use this application.

When you remotely lock your device, this application can show a message on the lockscreen for whoever finds your phone.\n\nIf you don\'t give this permission, this functionality will not be activated.
SecureGuard will occasionally send you notifications, for example to warn you that someone is locating your device.
This phone is Protected by SecureGuard!\nMessage from the owner:
GPS coordinates will be sent soon.
Your device is now locked. You will get notified if device usage is detected.
" locate - sends the current location of the phone"
" sentry - locks the phone, and detects phone usage"
Error gaining location from OpenCelliD. Please try the following the link. The parameters you want are \"lon\" and \"lat\".
SecureGuard: Usage detected. Someone might have used your phone.
SecureGuard: Usage detected. Someone might have used your phone.
Empty Command not allowed\n Returning to default.[/sg]

Here you can configure the application to communicate with SecureGuard server. If you want to configure a different server than default, you can do so by changing the URL. If you press "register" you can register the application to the server. Afterwards you can enable the server functionality. If you do so, your phone will send you location data to the specified server. You can check your phone\'s location by entering the ID and the password on the page.
" GPS (on/off) - turns the GPS on or off."
Sorry the application is not allowed to do so.
" expert - help page for expert commands."
If you want SecureGuard to handle messages from other applications such as Telegram, Whatsapp, etc., you can give FMD access to notifications.
" sound (on/off) - turns the sound on or off."
" camera (front/back) - takes a picture and sends it to SecureGuard server."
If you want to remotely receive pictures from your phone, the camera permission is needed.
"The device will soon send a picture to SecureGuard server. You can view it here soon: "
This device isn\'t registered on a server.
